Description: Fragment of oval handle at neck join of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine red-brown. Circular stamp with Helios head symbol.
Production date: 131 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '426'. Name Nikasagoras. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0175.09.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (200)
